formalText: She feels like James and she are really worried that she will suddenly get dramatically worse.
James doesn't like it when she makes jokes about suicide and sometimes she forgets them.
She was pretty bad a few weeks ago at just the beginning of the weekend.
She was real sad, and she's not right now.
She doesn't know at what point she starts feeling safe.
It would be more like must she start feeling safe more than she forgets that she is not safe, and she's not.
It's not that recognizing that she's not safe doesn't begin to protect her or anything like that.
She can really see the ways that the crazy has been passed down through the generations to her, and she doesn't know how to make it stop.
Both sides of her grandparents are nuts or were pretty unhappy, and their kids were pretty unhappy, and now she's pretty unhappy.
She doesn't know how to stop that.
She just feels like the pressure is on to be well.
Behind this she feels that they can have a better life without her, and for her, when she thinks about James leaving her,
she just can't handle it all, and there's nothing after that.
She feels like when she's worried about things getting bad, she feels like things could be bad tomorrow or even today.
She worries about people getting hurt by her.
She was thinking about suicide a lot, and at least part of it was at least she won't have to see it.
It wasn't great when she was a kid.
But at this point, whatever they think is okay is to make comments about her weight.
It's not all that great.
She really can't take care of James right now.
Both sides of her grandparents are nuts or were pretty unhappy, and their kids were pretty unhappy, and now she's pretty unhappy.
